verses.verse: Thanksgiving for Recovery from Grave Illness A Psalm. A Song at the dedication of the temple. Of David. (Ps 25.2; 28.9) I will extol you, O LORD, for you have drawn me up and did not let my foes rejoice over me.
(Ps 6.2; 88.13) O LORD my God, I cried to you for help, and you have healed me.
(Ps 28.1; 86.13) O LORD, you brought up my soul from Sheol, restored me to life from among those gone down to the Pit. (Or that I should not go down to the Pit)
(Ps 50.5; 97.12; 149.1) Sing praises to the LORD, O you his faithful ones, and give thanks to his holy name.
(Ps 63.3; 103.9) For his anger is but for a moment; his favor is for a lifetime. Weeping may linger for the night, but joy comes with the morning.
As for me, I said in my prosperity, “I shall never be moved.”
(Ps 104.29) By your favor, O LORD, you had established me as a strong mountain; you hid your face; I was dismayed.
To you, O LORD, I cried, and to the LORD I made supplication:
(Ps 6.5) “What profit is there in my death, if I go down to the Pit? Will the dust praise you? Will it tell of your faithfulness?
Hear, O LORD, and be gracious to me! O LORD, be my helper!” (Or The LORDheard and was gracious to me; the LORDbecame my helper)
(Ps 4.7; 6.8; Jer 31.4, 13) You have turned my mourning into dancing; you have taken off my sackcloth and clothed me with joy,
(Ps 16.9; 44.8) so that my soul (Heb that glory) may praise you and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks to you forever.
